questions.questionText: What is a correct syntax to output 'Hello World' in Java?
questions.explanation: System.out.println('Hello World') is used to display on the screen

options.text: It is the process where one object acquires the properties of another.
Inheritance is the ability of an object to take on many forms.
Inheritance is a technique to define different methods of same type.

questions.explanation: It is the process where one object acquires the properties of another. With the use of inheritance the information is made manageable in a hierarchical order.

questions.questionText: What is the default value of String variable?
questions.explanation: String variable has default value of null if defined as an instance/static variable.

questions.questionText: Method Overriding is an example of
questions.explanation: Method Overriding is example of dynamic Binding.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a marker interface?
_____ is used to find and fix bugs in the Java programs.
questions.explanation: The Java Debugger (JDB or jdb) is a command-line java debugger that debugs the java class. It is a part of the Java Platform Debugger Architecture (JPDA) that helps in the inspections and debugging of a local or remote Java Virtual Machine (JVM).

questions.questionText: What is the return type of the hashCode() method in the Object class?
questions.explanation: In Java, the return type of hashCode() method is an integer, as it returns a hash code value for the object.

questions.questionText: Which method of the Class.class is used to determine the name of a class represented by the class object as a String?
questions.explanation: The getName() method of the Class class returns the name (as String) of the entity (class, interface) represented by this Class object. It is a non-static method, and available in the java.lang package.

questions.questionText: Which package contains the Random class?
questions.explanation: The Random class is available in the java.util package. An object of the Random class is used to generate a series of pseudorandom numbers. And the object of this class is a thread-safe and cryptographically insecure object. The Random class provides a variety of methods that are used to create random numbers of type integers, float, long, double, etc.
